data.title: Letter Count
data.solution:
s = input() # get the input string
s = s.lower() # convert the string to lowercase
letter_counts = {} # initialize an empty dictionary to store the letter counts

# iterate through each letter in the string
for letter in s:
  if letter in letter_counts: # if the letter has already been seen
    letter_counts[letter] += 1 # increment the count
  else: # if the letter has not been seen before
    letter_counts[letter] = 1 # add a new entry to the dictionary with a count of 1

l=[]

for j in letter_counts.values():
    l.append(j)


a=0
# print the dictionary of letter counts
for i in letter_counts:
    print(i + " " + str(l[a]))
    a+=1
data.statement: You are given a string. You need to calculate how many times each letter appears in the string. You should ignore the case of the letters (i.e., treat "A" and "a" as the same letter). As a result, you should write the counts with a space.

data.outputDescription: Return a dictionary in the format of {letter number of occurrences}, showing how many times each letter appears.Output must be alphabetical and lowercase.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You are given a string. You need to calculate how many times each letter appears in the string. You should ignore the case of the letters (i.e., treat "A" and "a" as the same letter). As a result, you should write the counts with a space.
Input
Line 1: A string s
Output
Return a dictionary in the format of {letter number of occurrences}, showing how many times each letter appears.Output must be alphabetical and lowercase.
Constraints
1 ≤ length of s ≤ 100
Example
Input
abcdefg
Output
a 1
b 1
c 1
d 1
e 1
f 1
g 1
